description: Understand object-oriented concepts in JavaScript: objects, properties, methods, and the 'this' keyword.

slides.title: What is an Object?
slides.content:
# Objects ğŸ“¦

In real life, a car is an object.
- **Properties:** weight, color.
- **Methods:** start, stop.

In JS, objects are variables too, but they can contain many values.

```javascript
const car = {type:"Fiat", model:"500", color:"white"};
```

slides.title: Properties
slides.content:
# Accessing Properties ğŸ”‘

Two ways to access properties:

1. **Dot Notation** (Common)
```javascript
car.type;
```

2. **Bracket Notation**
```javascript
car["type"];
```
Bracket notation is useful when the property name is stored in a variable.

slides.title: This Keyword
slides.content:
# The 'this' Keyword ğŸ‘ˆ

In an object method, `this` refers to the **object** itself.

In the previous example, `this.firstName` means the `firstName` property of **this object** (person).

> âš ï¸ **Note:** `this` works differently in arrow functions!

slides.title: Constructors
Looping Objects
Adding/Deleting Properties
slides.content:
# Modifying Objects âœï¸

Objects are mutable.

## Add Property
```javascript
person.nationality = "English";
```

## Delete Property
```javascript
delete person.age;
```

slides.title: Object.values/keys
slides.content:
# Conversion to Array ğŸ“‹

Sometimes you need an array form.

- `Object.keys(obj)`: Returns array of keys.
- `Object.values(obj)`: Returns array of values.
- `Object.entries(obj)`: Returns array of [key, value] pairs.

```javascript
Object.keys(person); // ["fname", "lname", "age"]
```
